Topic.Title: I am Leaving ATT after 10 Years , going to T mobile

Message.Msg: ATT rates are ridiculous. They say they have 4G speed but at those speeds you can max out your plan in 2 hours watching 1 movie. The customers are not stupid, they can see they pay way more than prepaid unlimited service. $150 vs $42.00 (adjusted for taxes) 3G is faster than my home internet connection. Why do I need a bigger pipe? To work with poorly optimized SAAS, or to pay data overages if you ever use the thing? $50 for 5G after adding $70 for unlimited is ridiculous. $120 a month is far too much. They can't compete with sprint on price. Sprint can't make any money, but attrition is starting to work for them. I don't believe T-mobile got these subscribers unless it was at the metroPCS rate.

Message.Title: No need to jump off bridges...
Message.Msg: While some people may delight in today's terrible day, this is not a bridge jumping moment. It also doesn't mean to stay away from sharp objects. To say this is the end of the world doesn't play either. Maybe the report didn't set well with some investors. Less than 24 hours ago, some buyers saw fit to plunk down 39.00 a share. There is no way in hell the earnings (or lack of) report warrants this kind of selling pressure. But it is what it is. How does anyone explain a company take a 4 Billion dollar hit and barely blink...then take a 5% hit for a report that hardly can be described as lackluster? One thing I won't write is this is a "buying opportunity". In a sense it is, but we would have preferred upside movement rather than a jolt like this. Once things settle down and investors come to their senses, they will seek the respectable dividend and look forward to T re-starting where we left off at last nights close. Profit taking was inevitable. The report gave the profiteers the opportunity to cash in. T will get it together and continue its modest price appreciation and continue paying the nice dividend we are accustomed to. Trollers, shorters and the haters will say "told you so". Don't concern yourself with them or the current circumstances. Tomorrow will probably rebound some and in a month or two, today will be forgotten.

Topic.Title: Boston Attack

Message.Msg: Additionally, I heard a talking head saying that because the price of a 'coyote' to get across the border has gone up about a thousand percent, that is proof that our border security is sound and much better. I guess he has never heard of inflation or supply and demand's impact of pricing. Part of the problem is that many in the U.S. listen to comments like this and assume it is the gospel truth. We CANNOT change these rules until we have the borders secured. Not because we don't like Mexican's because a good many of those crossing aren't from Mexico. They are from other Central American countries, Asia and the Middle East. We have no idea how many are crossing to work and better their lives or how many are joining sleeper cells or with plans to blow something/somebody up. There may not be a great many terrorist crossing from Mexico, but the key is that WE DON'T KNOW! This is not just an immigration issue, this is a national security issue and our government won't admit it.

Topic.Title: No need to jump off bridges...

Message.Msg: As a longtime shareholder, I too hope that the sell-off and 5% drop was an aberration. However, I also have to question what actual business growth or growth prospects moved the needle on the stock price from $32 to $39? T needs to replace declining revenue streams in wireline with increasing revenues in markets such as enterprise, The recent Qtrly report indicates that both the wireless and enterprise markets have softened; while expected FCF will need be maintained by capex reductions. While AT&T continues to make sound business decisions; near-term market instability may drive further declines in T stock price.

Topic.Title: No need to jump off bridges...

Message.Msg: If you are a long time stockholder, I assume you are more interested in the nice dividend than you are appreciation. If you want price and growth action, you would be better off elsewhere. There are many factors to consider and you don't state your objectives, so it is difficult to assess what your objective is. Reading your analysis of T, I understand your concern. Saturation of smart phones is at hand. That's one reason why T is seeking other avenues to make money. Tablets, increasing spectrum, overseas markets, new phone products (without the onerous subsidy they pay Aapl), network upgrades are all on the table. Both now and in the future. T mobile failed, but they tried to get bigger by acquisition. Who knows what's next. I'm in for the long term. However, I know how to read writing on the wall and would sell without giving it a second thought if red flags appear. Fortunately, i don't see any writing yet. But should that occur, I'd move on and find a suitable replacement. I suggest patience. Keep abreast of anything pertinent to T that might be adverse and follow your instincts. Otherwise, enjoy a very nice dividend for quite some time.

Topic.Title: price

Message.Msg: You're absolutely right Blair. But it is a topic worthy of discussion. It beats a lot of other stuff we see here isn't it?

Topic.Title: Wouldn't this be an opportune time to buy back the stock that T promised?

Message.Msg: Something else I would like to see is Yahoo do something about all of the spam posting, I'm tired of seeing the MSIM posts. I ignore, I report, & I complain,, is there another message board to go to beside YAHOO?

Message.Title: Union entitlements are killing VZ.
Message.Msg: Who else is being killed by union entitlements hubcap? Does it #$%$ you off my wife is employed by a union grocery chain? Or our son and his wife are county union employees? How about my son in law and brother in law who are both sworn peace officers and are in the policeman's union? For that matter, a daughter and daughter in law are in nurses unions too. Are their respective employers being killed too? Waiting for your lame#$%$ response.

Topic.Title: No need to jump off bridges...

Message.Msg: Agree. Investors that are coming back to the equity market are looking to buy stable large caps that pay a nice dividend (3%+) as they just can't get any yield at the local bank or from bonds. This company offers an exceptional yield for those that want to diversify away from MLP's, REITs, and closed end high yield funds, and they really don't care what the rev growth is as long as it is positive and EPS is also climbing. Given that, one can assume they will always have a chance to get out of it at a profit in the longer term, while collecting a great comparable yield. Give it a couple of days and it will begin moving right back up as other large caps have after missing their revenue number.

Topic.Title: Wouldn't this be an opportune time to buy back the stock that T promised?

Message.Msg: That's all you can do Whop. Report/ignore and go on about your business. You would think Yahoo would do something. The very least would be to charge for advertising, or suspending accounts if they persist and don't ante up some fees. Just do what your doing and in a few days, you'll forget about it. I know its annoying, but thats the only way to deal with it. BTW, same goes for the Trollers. Just click ignore and away they go.

Message.Title: Why you don't have a CLUE. ! $ 370 BILLION NOW ON MARGIN, fools
Message.Msg: Approaching the $381 Bil 2007 record, you are witnessing fast money, without ANY NET INVESTED CASH, no skin in the game, all margined to the hilt into dividend stocks. That's the "investors" who took it from $32 to $39, coming to a casino near you soon, in a big way.

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are constraining ATT

Message.Msg: What's with the AT&T union vendetta Capper? Did you apply and fail the AT&T employment test? If the concept of unions bothers you so much, you need mental counseling. You sound like the kind of idiot that will make the nightly news at some point. I was a proud O.R.T.T. and CWA union steward for many years. Maybe you'd like to mouth off about that too?

Message.Title: Union entitlements are constraining VZ
Message.Msg: It's good to know Verizon is union free. That explains why they are so successful.

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are constraining VZ

Message.Msg: I think that employee ownership is even better than being union free. AT&T would do well if they offered the stock they are buying back to their employees who choose to do so, to take up to 20% of their pay in company stock. Not only would it improve cash flow, it would also improve moral and eventually replace the unions. Just imagine employees and management being on the same team. It is working well for WINCO in the grocery business. They are not even listed on a stock exchange because all of their stock is owned by employees and they choose the board of directors. Travelers Insurance is also involved in some way.

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are constraining ATT

Message.Msg: Dave: What is your view of employee ownership of a company? Seems to me that going to work every day in your own company would provide more incentive.

Topic.Title: Why you don't have a CLUE. ! $ 370 BILLION NOW ON MARGIN, fools

Message.Msg: Sure is a good thing margin is as limited as it is. Back in the late 1920s you only needed 10% and could buy the 90% on margin. We all know how that turned out. Now you can do almost the same thing with options.

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are constraining ATT

Message.Msg: My incentive came naturally. Great job, excellent union benefits, 401K that made a good deal of $$$. Health insurance for very reasonable premiums. life insurance nearly a quarter million buy out in lieu of monthly stipend. Need more Wilkie? No wonder there is jealousy out there among the bitter that wish they had our deal.

Topic.Title: No need to jump off bridges...

Message.Msg: wcsg said " Give it a couple of days and it will begin moving right back up". Guess he didn't notice it has been moving up steadily since 11:30 this morning. Expect it to continue.

Topic.Title: No need to jump off bridges...

Message.Msg: You can make it all back by purchasing July 40 calls tomorrow. This retracement was long overdue and I bought puts for insurance. It really paid off. I didn't lose anything today but sold my puts and bought calls. Still looking forward to July now instead of May.

Topic.Title: Union entitlements are constraining ATT

Message.Msg: I have seen posts of AT&T employees that are bitter. Of course they might be bitter no matter what. It just seems to me that employee ownership of the company would provide all the things you received plus a better attitude toward the job and all without union dues or union politics.
